How to Install leptonica-progs on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • leptonica-progs

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install leptonica-progs on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing leptonica-progs on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall leptonica-progs in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install leptonica-progs, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install leptonica-progs Using apt

To install leptonica-progs in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install leptonica-progs using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install leptonica-progs

The installation of leptonica-progs might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install leptonica-progs Using apt-get

To install leptonica-progs using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install leptonica-progs.

sudo apt-get -y install leptonica-progs

Install leptonica-progs Using Synaptic

To install leptonica-progs using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install leptonica-progs on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for leptonica-progs. This will display the leptonica-progs package in the package window, now to install leptonica-progs, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the leptonica-progs package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of leptonica-progs.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install leptonica-progs Using aptitude

To install leptonica-progs on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of leptonica-progs.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install leptonica-progs using the command aptitude install leptonica-progs.

sudo aptitude -y install leptonica-progs

How to Upgrade leptonica-progs on debian

If you want to upgrade the leptonica-progs package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade leptonica-progs using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade leptonica-progs to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade leptonica-progs.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade leptonica-progs sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade leptonica-progs

Upgrade leptonica-progs using Aptitude

To upgrade leptonica-progs using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade leptonica-progs.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade leptonica-progs

Upgrade leptonica-progs using Synaptic

To upgrade leptonica-progs using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for leptonica-progs, now right-click leptonica-progs, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade leptonica-progs just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall leptonica-progs on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall leptonica-progs from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just leptonica-progs, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove leptonica-progs

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of leptonica-progs

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of leptonica-progs you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge leptonica-progs

Remove leptonica-progs using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall leptonica-progs using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for leptonica-progs, right-click the leptonica-progs package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall leptonica-progs click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install leptonica-progs on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade leptonica-progs using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of leptonica-progs then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
